Part 1: Statistical visualization

Loading required packages

Hide the code 
pacman::p_load(plotly, DT, patchwork, tidyverse, ggstatsplot)

Importing data

Hide the code 
exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")

Working with Plot_ly() method

Hide the code 
plot_ly(data = exam_data, 
        x = ~ENGLISH, 
        y = ~MATHS, 
        color = ~RACE)

Changing color with color palette

Hide the code 
plot_ly(data = exam_data, 
        x = ~ENGLISH, 
        y = ~MATHS, 
        color = ~RACE, 
        colors = "Set1")

Changing to self-defined colors

Hide the code 
my_colors <- c("pink","skyblue","lightgreen","grey")
plot_ly(data = exam_data, 
        x = ~ENGLISH, 
        y = ~MATHS, 
        color = ~RACE, 
        colors = my_colors)

Working with ggplotly() method

Hide the code 
p <- ggplot(data=exam_data, 
            aes(x = MATHS,
                y = ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point(dotsize = 1) +
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100),
                  ylim=c(0,100))
ggplotly(p)

Coordinated Multiple Views with plotly

Hide the code 
d <- highlight_key(exam_data)  #<<
p1 <- ggplot(data=d, 
            aes(x = MATHS,
                y = ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point(size=1) +
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100),
                  ylim=c(0,100))

p2 <- ggplot(data=d, 
            aes(x = MATHS,
                y = SCIENCE)) +
  geom_point(size=1) +
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100),
                  ylim=c(0,100))
subplot(ggplotly(p1),
        ggplotly(p2))

Working with ggstatsplot

Two-sample mean test: ggbetweenstats()

Hide the code 
ggbetweenstats(
  data = exam_data,
  x = GENDER, 
  y = MATHS,
  type = "np",
  messages = FALSE
)

Significant Test of Correlation: ggscatterstats()

Hide the code 
ggscatterstats(
  data = exam_data,
  x = MATHS,
  y = ENGLISH,
  marginal = TRUE,
  )

Part 2: Visualizing models

Loading packages

Hide the code 
pacman::p_load(readxl, performance, parameters, see)

Importing data

Hide the code 
car_resale <- read_xls("data/ToyotaCorolla.xls", 
                       "data")
car_resale

Multiple Regression Model using lm()

Hide the code 
model <- lm(Price ~ Age_08_04 + Mfg_Year + KM + 
              Weight + Guarantee_Period, data = car_resale)
model

Call:
lm(formula = Price ~ Age_08_04 + Mfg_Year + KM + Weight + Guarantee_Period, 
    data = car_resale)

Coefficients:
     (Intercept)         Age_08_04          Mfg_Year                KM  
      -2.637e+06        -1.409e+01         1.315e+03        -2.323e-02  
          Weight  Guarantee_Period  
       1.903e+01         2.770e+01

Model Diagnostic: checking for multicolinearity:

Hide the code 
check_collinearity(model)
# Check for Multicollinearity

Low Correlation

             Term   VIF     VIF 95% CI Increased SE Tolerance Tolerance 95% CI
 Guarantee_Period  1.04   [1.01, 1.17]         1.02      0.97     [0.86, 0.99]
        Age_08_04 31.07 [28.08, 34.38]         5.57      0.03     [0.03, 0.04]
         Mfg_Year 31.16 [28.16, 34.48]         5.58      0.03     [0.03, 0.04]

High Correlation

   Term  VIF   VIF 95% CI Increased SE Tolerance Tolerance 95% CI
     KM 1.46 [1.37, 1.57]         1.21      0.68     [0.64, 0.73]
 Weight 1.41 [1.32, 1.51]         1.19      0.71     [0.66, 0.76]

Visualize multicollinearity

VIF, log scaled of more than 10 = multicollinearity that needs to be addressed.

Hide the code 
check_c <- check_collinearity(model)
plot(check_c)

Remove “Mfg_Year” from model due to collinearity

Hide the code 
model1 <- lm(Price ~ Age_08_04 + Weight + KM
             + Guarantee_Period, data = car_resale)

Check normality assumption

Hide the code 
check_n <- check_normality(model1)
Hide the code 
plot(check_n)

Check heteroscedasticity

Hide the code 
check_h <- check_heteroscedasticity(model1)
Hide the code 
plot(check_h)

Complete check

Hide the code 
check_model(model1)

Visualising Regression Parameters: see methods

Hide the code 
plot(parameters(model1))

Visualising Regression Parameters: ggcoefstats() methods

Hide the code 
ggcoefstats(model1, 
            output = "plot")

Part 3: Visualising uncertainty (Standard errors)

Hide the code 
pacman::p_load(crosstalk, DT, ggdist, gganimate)
Hide the code 
my_sum <- exam_data %>%
  group_by(RACE) %>%
  summarise(
    n=n(),
    mean=mean(MATHS),
    sd=sd(MATHS)
    ) %>%
  mutate(se=sd/sqrt(n-1))
Hide the code 
knitr::kable(head(my_sum), format = 'html')
RACE n mean sd se
Chinese 193 76.50777 15.69040 1.132357
Indian 12 60.66667 23.35237 7.041005
Malay 108 57.44444 21.13478 2.043177
Others 9 69.66667 10.72381 3.791438
Hide the code 
ggplot(my_sum) +
  geom_errorbar(
    aes(x=RACE, 
        ymin=mean-se, 
        ymax=mean+se), 
    width=0.2, 
    colour="black", 
    alpha=0.9, 
    size=0.5) +
  geom_point(aes
           (x=RACE, 
            y=mean), 
           stat="identity", 
           color="red",
           size = 1.8,
           alpha=1) +
  ggtitle("Standard error of mean 
          maths score by race")
